t: The Beauty and Glory of Zion.
A Song; a Psalm of the sons of Korah.
Great*pn is the Lord,*s and greatly to be praised, In*ln the city of our God, His holy mountain.
Beautiful*ln in elevation, the joy of the whole earth, Is*ln Mount Zion in*i the far north, The*ln city of the great King.
God,*ln in her palaces, Has*ln made Himself known as a stronghold.
For,*ln lo, the kings assembled themselves, They*ln passed by together.
They*ln saw it,*i then they were amazed; They*ln were terrified, they fled in alarm.
Panic*ln seized them there, Anguish,*ln as of a woman in childbirth.
With*ln the east wind You*ln break the ships of Tarshish.
As*ln we have heard, so have we seen In*ln the city of the Lord*s of hosts, in the city of our God; God*ln will establish her forever. Selah.
We*ln have thought on Your lovingkindness, O God, In*ln the midst of Your temple.
As*ln is Your name, O God, So*ln is Your praise to the ends of the earth; Your*ln right hand is full of righteousness.
Let*ln Mount Zion be glad, Let*ln the daughters of Judah rejoice Because*ln of Your judgments.
Walk*ln about Zion and go around her; Count*ln her towers;
Consider*ln her ramparts; Go*ln through her palaces, That*ln you may tell it*i to the next generation.
For*ln such is God, Our*ln God forever and ever; He*ln will guide us until death.
